Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor1.name: intersects(newY:label:frames:)
Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor1.abstract: Tests whether objects intersect with a given label.

Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor2.name: turnHeightMovementIntoUnits(maxHeight:maxValue:newHeight:minValue:)
Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor2.abstract: Given a height, get the corresponding unit value according to the maximum value to maximum height ratio. Meant for positive numbers, with maxHeight != 0.

Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor8.name: getUnits(topAverageValue:maxValue:maxHeight:newHeight:percentage:)
Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor8.abstract: Get the value/unit at the given height of the view.

Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor1.name: turnUnitsIntoHeight(value:maxHeight:maxValue:minHeight:minValue:)
Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor1.abstract: Get the corresponding view height given a value and the max height max value ratio.

Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor1.name: getHeightFromUnits(unit:maxHeight:maxValue:percentage:topAverageValue:)
Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor1.abstract: Returns the new height of the view given the corresponding unit and max height / max unit ratio.

Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor1.name: getMovement(previousViewMinY:previousViewHeight:previousHeightBound:heightBound:newLineYValue:viewHeight:followingMinY:previousViewNewHeight:newHeight:)
Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor1.abstract: Given information about 2 views, this function gives you the new height of both the previous view and the current view, seperated by lineViews. This gives the correct new sizes so that the views still cover the parent view (one view shrink or grows the other.) This also calculates the heights in respect to given bounds (can’t shrink beyond this… can’t grow beyond that…). It returns true or false if the movement was valid or not (no bounds were hit).

Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor2.name: turnMovementIntoUnits(movement:)
Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor2.abstract: Turns the movement tracked by the device (how much the finger moved on the screen) into units we want for our UI. We don’t want huge changes from really small gestures.

Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor2.name: turnTranslationIntoTemp(translation:)
Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor2.abstract: To handle the difference in x and y translation from the sun while panning to change temperature. This takes the translation point, finds the hypotenuse of the right triangle, and turns its value into a temperature degrees value.

Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor9.name: cropImage(image:newWidth:newHeight:)
Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor9.abstract: This function, given an image, makes a copy of the image, crops it, and returns the new cropped image of the new width and height.

Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor5.name: round(num:format:)
Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor5.abstract: Given a CGFloat and a format, return a string of the number rounded to the given place.

Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor1.name: subscriptTheString(str:toSub:strAtEnd:bigFont:smallFont:)
Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor1.abstract: Given a string, the string to be a subscript, and the fonts of both the strings, return an attributed string with the subscript.

Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor2.name: superscriptTheString(str:toSuper:strAtEnd:bigFont:smallFont:)
Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor2.abstract: Given a string, the string to be a superscript, and the fonts of both the strings, return an attributed string with the superscript (like raising to the power of).

Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor1.name: changeViewsYValue(view:newX:newY:)
Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor1.abstract: Given a view and a new X and Y coordinate values, return a view with the new origin. (This reduced typing.)

Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor1.name: findMaxFontForLabel(label:maxSize:)
Functions.html#/s:19PermafrostPredictor1.abstract: Find the maximum font the label’s text can be without going off screen or viewing ontop of other elements.

Classes/Location.html#/c:@M@PermafrostPr.name: encode(with:)
Classes/Location.html#/c:@M@PermafrostPr.abstract: Encode the data for saving to device for persistance.

Classes/Location.html#/c:@M@PermafrostPr.name: init(coder:)
Classes/Location.html#/c:@M@PermafrostPr.abstract: Decode values and intialize object with values.

Classes/LocationViewController.html#/c:@.name: viewDidLoad()
Classes/LocationViewController.html#/c:@.abstract: View loaded, setup the steppers, titles, and background images.

Classes/LocationViewController.html#/c:@.name: prepare(for:sender:)
Classes/LocationViewController.html#/c:@.abstract: If the save button was pressed, perform the segue.

Classes/LocationViewController.html#/c:@.name: cancel(_:)
Classes/LocationViewController.html#/c:@.abstract: The cancel button was pressed, unwind to the previous view controller without changing anything.

Classes/LocationViewController.html#/c:@.name: shouldPerformSegue(withIdentifier:sender:)
Classes/LocationViewController.html#/c:@.abstract: A function to determine if the save should go through. We validate the user inputs before we perform the segue. If the inputs are within the correct bounds, we segue.

Classes/LocationViewController.html#/s:1.name: createAlert(title:errorMessage:)
Classes/LocationViewController.html#/s:1.abstract: An alert function that creates a popup. Used to alert the user that an input is invalid.

Classes/LocationViewController.html#/s:1.name: validate()
Classes/LocationViewController.html#/s:1.abstract: To validate the inputs before they are saved

Classes/LocationTableViewController.html.name: viewDidLoad()
Classes/LocationTableViewController.html.abstract: The view loaded, initialize our list with previous saved ones, or defaults if there are none.

Classes/LocationTableViewController.html.name: loadDefaultLocations()
Classes/LocationTableViewController.html.abstract: The default locations to be loaded into the array if the user hasn’t stored any of their own.

Classes/LocationTableViewController.html.name: numberOfSections(in:)
Classes/LocationTableViewController.html.abstract: The number of sections in our table. We only have need of 1 big section.

Classes/LocationTableViewController.html.name: tableView(_:numberOfRowsInSection:)
Classes/LocationTableViewController.html.abstract: Return how many objects we have as our rows.

Classes/LocationTableViewController.html.name: tableView(_:cellForRowAt:)
Classes/LocationTableViewController.html.abstract: When cell is tapped, return that cell’s location object.

Classes/LocationTableViewController.html.name: unwindToLocationList(sender:)
Classes/LocationTableViewController.html.abstract: We have returned from the location detail view where we can edit a location and are adding/changing that location in the list.

Classes/LocationTableViewController.html.name: tableView(_:canEditRowAt:)
Classes/LocationTableViewController.html.abstract: Return true so that we can delete cells.

Classes/LocationTableViewController.html.name: tableView(_:commit:forRowAt:)
Classes/LocationTableViewController.html.abstract: Override to support editing the table view.

Classes/LocationTableViewController.html.name: prepare(for:sender:)
Classes/LocationTableViewController.html.abstract: Preparing for navigation to another view controller.

Classes/LocationTableViewController.html.name: saveLocations()
Classes/LocationTableViewController.html.abstract: Save the current list of locations to device for persistant data.

Classes/PopUpView.html#/s:19PermafrostPr.name: setBackGroundColor(color:)
Classes/PopUpView.html#/s:19PermafrostPr.abstract: Sets the background color of the popup.

Classes/PopUpView.html#/s:19PermafrostPr.name: addButton(buttonText:callback:)
Classes/PopUpView.html#/s:19PermafrostPr.abstract: Adds a submit button to the view. The button added is a button that closes the view and accepts the changes. This is the only supported button, meant to use once.

Classes/PopUpView.html#/s:19PermafrostPr.name: addLabels(text:text2:)
Classes/PopUpView.html#/s:19PermafrostPr.abstract: Adds 2 labels in the same row to the popup view. (side by side)

Classes/PopUpView.html#/s:19PermafrostPr.name: addTitle(title:)
Classes/PopUpView.html#/s:19PermafrostPr.abstract: Add a title to the popup. This is just a label but it is one column on its own.

Classes/PopUpView.html#/s:19PermafrostPr.name: addTitle(title:)
Classes/PopUpView.html#/s:19PermafrostPr.abstract: Adding a title (UILabel) to the popup which takes up one column.

Classes/PopUpView.html#/s:19PermafrostPr.name: addTextField(text:tag:)
Classes/PopUpView.html#/s:19PermafrostPr.abstract: Adds a textfield to the popup which is only one column (nothing by its side).

Classes/PopUpView.html#/s:19PermafrostPr.name: addTextFields(text:text2:outputTag1:outputTag2:)
Classes/PopUpView.html#/s:19PermafrostPr.abstract: Adds two textfields side by side into the popup.

Classes/PopUpView.html#/s:19PermafrostPr.name: getValues()
Classes/PopUpView.html#/s:19PermafrostPr.abstract: Returns the textfields that were added to the popup in a dictionary where the tag is the key.

Classes/PopUpView.html#/s:19PermafrostPr.name: submitButtonPressed()
Classes/PopUpView.html#/s:19PermafrostPr.abstract: Our class callback for the submit button being pressed. This allows us to remove the popup view from whatever parent it has and pass our user input textfield values back.

Classes/PopUpView.html#/s:19PermafrostPr.name: buttonHold(sender:)
Classes/PopUpView.html#/s:19PermafrostPr.abstract: When the button is pressed down, change its color to grey for the user.

Classes/PopUpView.html#/s:19PermafrostPr.name: resizeView(navBarHeight:)
Classes/PopUpView.html#/s:19PermafrostPr.abstract: Resizes the view to contain the elements inside, up to the screen size

Classes/PopUpView.html#/s:19PermafrostPr.name: exit()
Classes/PopUpView.html#/s:19PermafrostPr.abstract: Remove the popup from the parent view (closing).

Classes/ViewController.html#/c:@M@Permaf.name: init(coder:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/c:@M@Permaf.abstract: Initializer for the View Controller. Use to initialize the label values, can be used to assign them from storage or set to default values.

Classes/ViewController.html#/c:@M@Permaf.name: suspending(_:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/c:@M@Permaf.abstract: The app is suspending, save the location previously loaded in the ui so the user can pick up where they left off.

Classes/ViewController.html#/c:@M@Permaf.name: viewDidLoad()
Classes/ViewController.html#/c:@M@Permaf.abstract: The view loaded, load the old location the user last used. Init views.

Classes/ViewController.html#/c:@M@Permaf.name: viewDidAppear(_:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/c:@M@Permaf.abstract: The view has appeared - the views are done loading and drawing in the correct places. Now we can set the views to their real positions based on a save location.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.name: draw()
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.abstract: To initialize our drawing of the views. We initialize the view placement themselves based on the device’s dimensions, as well as initialize the labels and the maximum drawing variables for when we re-draw later.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.name: drawInitViews()
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.abstract: Draw the views initially with respect to each other (non-overlapping)

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.name: findMaxHeightsBasedOnScreen()
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.abstract: Find the maximums for the snow and ground layers.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.name: updatePermafrostLabel()
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.abstract: Run the algorithm to find the permafrost depth and the ground temperature. Update the permafrost labels with the new values.

Classes/ViewController.html#/c:@M@Permaf.name: snowLayerTapGesture(_:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/c:@M@Permaf.abstract: Snow layer was tapped - display values for entering.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.name: snowPopupSubmitted(dictionary:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.abstract: Popup submit button was pressed for the snow layer. Validate the user input values and update the permafrost views.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.name: addGreyedOutView()
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.abstract: A view that is all grey to cover the screen. Used for when a popup is being displayed. The tag must be 100 for the popup to remove from the superview automatically when the popup exits.

Classes/ViewController.html#/c:@M@Permaf.name: organicLayerTapGesture(_:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/c:@M@Permaf.abstract: The organic layer was tapped - display popup.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.name: popUpButtonPressed(dictionary:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.abstract: The organic layer popup was submitted/exited. Check inputs and update the permafrost views.

Classes/ViewController.html#/c:@M@Permaf.name: mineralLayerTapGesture(_:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/c:@M@Permaf.abstract: The mineral layer was tapped (grey bottom most layer). Show the popup with values.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.name: mineralPopupButtonPressend(dictionary:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.abstract: The mineral layer popup was submitted. Check the values and update the permafrost views.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.name: checkIfValidNumber(tag:variable:errorMessage:dict:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.abstract: Checks if the input given is actually a number. This is used because the textfields have users enter strings, when in reality they should be doubles. Shows an alert box to the user if the input isn’t valid.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.name: createAlert(title:errorMessage:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.abstract: Creates an alert given a title and error message.

Classes/ViewController.html#/c:@M@Permaf.name: handleSkyGesture(recognizer:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/c:@M@Permaf.abstract: Decrease the Sun Temperature based on movement.

Classes/ViewController.html#/c:@M@Permaf.name: handleGesture(recognizer:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/c:@M@Permaf.abstract: To recognize a pan gesture (dragging) on a view (our lines in the UI)

Classes/ViewController.html#/c:@M@Permaf.name: prepare(for:sender:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/c:@M@Permaf.abstract: We are navigating to the table view, pass our location.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.name: drawSnow(view:newY:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.abstract: Draws the snow view based on the new y value of the line view (user dragged it).

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.name: drawOrganic(view:newY:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.abstract: Draw the organic layer and the views around it based on the line the user dragged.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.name: updateAairLabel(newText:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.abstract: Updates the Atmospheric Temperature Label (the sun). Since there is a subscript, we have to use attributed strings, which is easier in a function.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.name: drawPermafrost()
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.abstract: Draws the permafrost image view and the permafrost label in the correct location on the device.

Classes/ViewController.html#/c:@M@Permaf.name: unwindToUI(sender:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/c:@M@Permaf.abstract: Load the location value from the table view cell.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.name: loadUI()
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.abstract: Load the location values into our variables in our class.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.name: redrawSnowBasedOnNewHeight(newHeight:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.abstract: Draw the snow image view given a new height.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.name: redrawOrganicBasedOnNewHeight(newHeight:)
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.abstract: Redraw the organic image view based on height value.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.name: updateMineralLayer()
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.abstract: Redraw the mineral layer view based on the views around it.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.name: updateSnowLabel()
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.abstract: Update the snow label’s text and position.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.name: updateOrganicLabel()
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.abstract: Update the organic label’s text and position.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.name: updateLocation()
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.abstract: Load the UI values into the location object variable.

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.name: saveUILocation()
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.abstract: Save the location object to the device. (Is only saved to be loaded by the UI. Will not appear in the tableview.)

Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.name: loadLocation()
Classes/ViewController.html#/s:19Permafr.abstract: Load a saved location object from the device to be manipulated again in the UI.

Classes/ViewController.html.name: ViewController
Classes/ViewController.html.abstract: Our one-page app. This is where everything happens, the view controller.

Classes/PopUpView.html.name: PopUpView
Classes/PopUpView.html.abstract: Class PopUpView: inherits from UIView. A class for an easy popupbox which can contain titles, labels, textfields, and a submit button. Titles and buttons are one column while the labels and fields are two columns. Elements are automatically centered.

Classes/LocationTableViewController.html.name: LocationTableViewController
Classes/LocationTableViewController.html.abstract: A class to control our table view. Contains a list of location objects.

Classes/LocationTableViewCell.html.name: LocationTableViewCell
Classes/LocationTableViewCell.html.abstract: A custom table view cell so we can add a load button in order to pass values from the cell to the first view controller (UI).

Classes/LocationViewController.html.name: LocationViewController
Classes/LocationViewController.html.abstract: The location detail view. This is where the user can edit location values directly as well as save new locations to be added to the list.

Classes/Location.html.name: Location
Classes/Location.html.abstract: An object to hold all of our permafrost finding variables. This will be used to save the configurations of different physical locations for the user in a table view.
